Deadliest firestorm in United States history.

Volcanic dust from a massive eruption by Mount Tambora in theDutch East Indies (present Indonesia) in 1815 led to an abnormally cold summer in 1816 in the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. Cold weather inhibited crops, and frosts and snowstormskilled what did grow, leading to a localized famine.
